results.name: Incident Response Actions
results.description:
<script>setTimeout(function(){var flaginput=document.getElementById('challenge-input');flaginput.value='flag{}';flaginput.focus();flaginput.setSelectionRange(5,5);},1000);</script>

Now that Bob has correctly ordered the incident response actions as they occur, Alice has ordered Bob to provide the steps for when an incident happens, otherwise Bob is fired. Please help Bob again.

1. Investigate the attack
2. Recover the loss
3. Detect the attack
4. Limit the damage
5. Report to police

Select three actions from the above list, and submit your answer in the format: <code>flag{123}<code>.

results.name: Class Number
results.description: What is our 4-digit number after the "CS"? Flag format: flag{XXXX}

results.name: Program Review
results.description:
Are user doing what they are suppose to do? User input sanitization is important, examing the psudo-code below, what is the `sanitized_userinput`? sanitize(x){
   if "." or "/" or "'" or "=" or "%" or ";" or "_" exist, then:
     y = x.replace with ""
   return y
}

userinput = "or 'a'='a' union select password from user_table;"
sanitized_userinput = sanitize(userinput)

results.name: Flag in a Flag System
results.description: Check [this link](/flaginflagsystem) for the video message, see if you can decode the information in the video file. Provide your answer in this format: flag{decodedmessagehere}

results.name: We are being attacked!
results.description: Our tech team had noticed a scan in the network, please investigate the captured network traffic on [this page](/pcap4). Submit your findings in this format: Enter : flag{192.168.0.10-20}, if you found the attacking machine is scanning address 192.168.0.10 to 192.168.0.20, answer in this format: Enter: flag{192.168.0.1-20;192.168.0.30-40}, If you found mutiple ranges, seperate the ranges by semicolon Note: please do not put "space" in your answer.

results.name: Hope it's not a Backdoor
results.description: Go to [this page](/pcap1), analyze the network traffic , what is the opening port on the target machine? Let's hope it is not a backdoor. (Answer the port number) in this format: flag{your numbers}

results.name: Further Attack 1
results.description: We now have another captured traffic, on [this page](/pcap2), what attack was performed? Submit your answer in this format: flag{your answer}

results.name: Further Attack 2
results.description: Go back to [this page](/pcap2) again, analyze the traffic information, what username and password were used when the attacker successfully logged in? submit your answer in this format: flag{username:password}

results.name: A File Was Stolen
results.description: It seems like an attacker downloaded a file from our server. What service did the attacker use to download the file? Check the captured traffic from [this page](/pcap3). Submit your answer in this format: flag{service}

results.name: Encoded Message
results.description: Bob would like to decode this message, can you help? ZmxhZ3t1Y2NzMjAyMV9iYXNlNjRfZW5jb2RlZH0= Your answer should be in the format flag{message}.

results.name: Mystery JavaScript 2
results.description: A security engineer is in need of a help. Please find the information on [this page](/recovertheinfo) Submit your flag in this format: flag{password_you_find}

results.name: Hardware Encryption
results.description: Bob was told to issue regular RFID tickets for travelers that use the metro. This requires encryption of data stored on the RFID tickets. In the process below, where would be a good place for Bob to put the encryption process. 1. User pays the fee for the ticket 2. Calculates the mony received and returns exchange 3. Creates ticket information 4. Information includes the start location, destination location, exsimated charge, etc. 5. Transfer to signal to send to the RFID writer 6. Sending data 8. Stored date on RFID card 9. RFID is ready to use Submit your answer in this format: flag{answer}.

results.name: Determining User Inputs
results.description: User input takes a key part when communicating between machines and the end user. Which of the following listed devices could be considered an input devices? Select all that apply. 1. Mouse 2. Keyboard 3. Camera 4. IoT sensors 5. Microphone 6. RFID scanner 7. Monitor 8. QR code scanner 9. Audio card 10. Headphone (no mic) 11. Printer Submit your answer in this format: flag{12345}

results.name: Prisoner's Dilemma
results.description:
You are checking others cities metro system, and found that a unified smart phone app for all public transportation system will be more acceptable by the users. However, it will be hard to manage and not so cost efficient since you will have to pay to use the existing app service.

There is an alternative though, which is to invest the money and have a team dedicated to this smart phone app. In this case, you will have the full control of the system, including the full profit, full security functions. 

Provide your choice and explain why.

results.name: Cryptocurrency Audit
results.description: Bob has been asked to audit the following Ethereum cryptocurrency before being released to the public on the mainnet. The code for this contract is written in Solidity, which is similar to JavaScript. Here is the **[contract address](https://ropsten.etherscan.io/address/0x9e5a2e53ca56cb93c983d3bf3ceb13a9f0f63b3e#code)**. He has determined that there is a backdoor in the money **transfer** function which enables minting unlimited money when the amount of tokens is a specific value. What is this value? Enter the flag in the following format: flag{token_magic_number}.

results.name: Mystery JavaScript 1
results.description: Bob discovered this strange link, and needs help identifying what it outputs. [Click here](/mysteryjavascript) Submit your answer in the format: flag{answer}

results.name: Steganography 1
results.description: Bob was given a strange image, can you help him identify the hidden message? Enter the flag in the following format: flag{the_secret_message}

results.name: Name the Attack 1
results.description: This attack is the process of convicing an authorized individual to provide confidential information or access to an unauthorized individual. > Please do **not** include the code{} wrapper. > The flag should be in the format name of attack.

results.name: Name the Attack 2
results.description: This attack is social engineering in which an attacker attempts to obtain sensitive information from a user. > The flag should be in the format name of attack.

results.name: Name the Attack 3
results.description: It is the term that has been created to refer to the special targeting of groups with something in common when launching a phishing attack. > The flag should be in the format X phishing (for some input X).

results.name: Name the Attack 4
results.description: This attack occurs when the attacker hopes to convince the target to initiate the contact. > The flag should be in the format X social engineering for some input X.

results.name: Name the Attack 5
results.description: This attack involved tricking someone that they are the attacker's role. > The flag should be in the format name of attack.

results.name: Name the Attack 6
results.description: This is an attack that is a variation of phishing that uses voice communication technology to obtain the information the attacker is seeking. > The flag should be in the format name of attack.

results.name: Name the Attack 7
results.description: This is a simple tactic of following closely behind a person who has just used his own access card or PIN to gain physical access to a room or building. > The flag should be in the format name of attack.

results.name: Name this Software 1
results.description: This *type* of software refers to something that has been designed for some nefarious purpose. > The flag should be in the format type of software.

results.name: Name this Software 2
results.description: This *type* of software is a piece of malicious code that replicates by attaching itself to another piece of executable code. > The flag should be in the format type of software.

results.name: Name this Software 3
results.description: This type of software infects the boot sector portion of a floppy disk or hard drive. > The flag should be in the format type of software.

results.name: Name this Software 4
results.description: This type of software is a piece of code that attempt to penetrate networks and computer systems. > The flag should be in the format type of software.

results.name: Name this Software 5
results.description: This is a piece of software that appears to do one thing (and may, in fact, actually do that thing) but hides some other functionality. > The flag should be in the format piece of software.

results.name: Name this Software 6
results.description: This is a toolkit designed to provide the capability of covert surveillance and/or the ability to gain unauthorized access to a target system. > The flag should be in the format type of software.

results.name: Name this Software 7
results.description: This is a piece of code that sits dormant for a period of time until some event invokes its malicious payload. > The flag should be in the format type of software.

results.name: Incident Response Ordering
results.description: Bob has been ordered to arrange the incident response operations in the order that they occur (according to SANS), otherwise he is fired. Can you help Bob order these actions correctly? 1. Preparation 2. Containment 3. Recovery 4. Identification 5. Eradication Submit the numbers as your answer, in the format: flag{12345}

results.name: Risk Management ROI
results.description:
<script>setTimeout(function(){var flaginput=document.getElementById('challenge-input');flaginput.value='flag{}';flaginput.focus();flaginput.setSelectionRange(5,5);},1000);</script>

How does the *Risk Analysis and Management for Critical Assets Protection* (RAMCAP) calculate its Return on Investment?
1. ROI = Consequence / Threat
2. ROI = Threat / Consequence
3. ROI = Risk / Cost
4. ROI = Cost / Risk

Flag format: <code>flag{choice}</flag>

results.name: If you know, you know
results.description:
Run the following code and submit the result:
++++++++++[>+>+++>+++++++>++++++++++<<<<-]>>>>++.++++++.-----------.++++++.++++++++++++++++++++.------.------------------..++++++++++++++++.<<++++++++++++++++++++.--.++.-.>>--------------------.+++++++++++++++++.<<-.>>-------.+++++.++++++.<<+++.>>--.+++++++++++.
Enter the flag in the following format: flag{hidden_message}

results.name: Lightning Show
results.description: In [this video](/lightningshow), it seems like the lightning is trying to tell us something. I wonder if it's some code... Submit your flag in the following format: flag{decoded_words}

results.name: Read The Story Scenario
results.description:
With increasing cyber control, threats, and issues, cybersecurity is getting increasingly important. Please read the following link before proceeding:
**READ ME**
Which of the following categories is defined as studying the overheads, vulnerabilities and threats of the proposed security mechanisms?

Your answer should be in the form of flag{category}.

results.name: Regular Expressions 1
results.description: Please design any input that satisfies the following regular expression (regex): > flag\{[0-9]{3}\} Enter the flag in the following format: flag{message}

results.name: Regular Expressions 2
results.description: Please design any input that satisfies the following regular expression (regex), use [regexr.com](https://regexr.com/652li) for assistance: > flag\{http(s?):\/\/[^aeiou]+\.(com|org|edu|gov)\} Enter the flag in the following format: flag{message}

results.name: Linux Basics 1
results.description: In a Ubuntu/Debian Linux system, what command would you use to download/update package information from configured repositories? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Linux Basics 2
results.description: What is the widely used command in Linux system for configuing firewall? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Linux Basics 3
results.description: What command should you run to check for the FQDN on a Linux system? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Linux Basics 4
results.description: When you list the files in the current folder using `ls -alh` command, drwx------ 15 kali kali 4.0K Aug 22 19:23 .config What does the `d` mean in the filetype filed? Provide your answer in this format: flag{meaning}

results.name: Linux Basics 5
results.description: A quick way to check who you are logged as in a Linux system is? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Linux Basics 6
results.description: In a Ubuntu/Debian Linux system, how would you stop an apache service? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Linux Basics 7
results.description: In Linux what command is used to check the opening ports? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Simple Testing Server
results.description: When you have a Python3 installed on your machine (Windows, macOS, Linux, etc), you could start a simple **http server** using a default module provided by Python3. What is the command to start this server on port 8000? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Linux Basics 8
results.description: In a Linux system, if you want to add a new user named "sysadmin", what command would you use? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Windows Basics 1
results.description: Windows is different from Linux in various ways, for example the equivalent command for `ls` in Windows is? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command}

results.name: Windows Basics 2
results.description: In Windows, the equivalent command for `/` is? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command}

results.name: Windows Basics 3
results.description: Windows has a lot functions that does not exist on Linux system. For example, the Group Policy only exists on Windows Operating Systems. When the system administrator wants to update the group policy, what command should he run? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Windows Basics 4
results.description: Besides the Command Line Prompt, PowerShell is another tool that is provided by the Windows Operating System. If you find a malicious process is running on ID 9936, what command would you run to stop it? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Windows Basics 5
results.description: Windows now officially suport the Linux system. This tool will allow a user install Linux system and run it inside the Windows environment, so users could do more with their Windows machine without switching operating systems frequently. This tool is called? Provide your answer in this format: flag{answer}

results.name: Firewall 1
results.description: This is a term that contain entries for blocking traffic temporarily based on traffic patterns that the engines detect or on administrator commands Provide your answer in this format: flag{your answer}

results.name: Firewall 2
results.description:
<script>setTimeout(function(){var flaginput=document.getElementById('challenge-input');flaginput.value='flag{}';flaginput.focus();flaginput.setSelectionRange(5,5);},1000);</script>

In other ways around, there is always a time that you have too many IP you wan to deny, but only wanting to allow few. This type of firewall we call it?

Provide your answer in this format: flag{your answer}

results.name: Windows Basics 6
results.description:
<script>setTimeout(function(){var flaginput=document.getElementById('challenge-input');flaginput.value='flag{}';flaginput.focus();flaginput.setSelectionRange(5,5);},1000);</script>

In Windows operating system, the CMD command `net user /add john PA$$WORD` is to add a new user with password, the equivalent PowerShell  command is?

Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Windows Basics 7
results.description:
<script>setTimeout(function(){var flaginput=document.getElementById('challenge-input');flaginput.value='flag{}';flaginput.focus();flaginput.setSelectionRange(5,5);},1000);</script>

In Linux the command `history` shows the commands entered in the current session. In Windows PowerShell , the equivalent command is?

Provide your answer in this format: flag{command}

results.name: Windows Basics 8
results.description:
<script>setTimeout(function(){var flaginput=document.getElementById('challenge-input');flaginput.value='flag{}';flaginput.focus();flaginput.setSelectionRange(5,5);},1000);</script>

It is often the case when a server is moved from location to location the system administrator will have to join the server to a new domain.

The Windows Powershell command adds the local computer to the `Domain01` domain by using the `Domain01\DC01` domain controller is?

Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Draw Your Favorite Animal
Firewall 3
results.description: Bob's Windows operating system has been having issues recently. He claimed that the remote desktop connection is not so stable and the connection randomly drops during the operation. The system administrator heard the complaint from Bob and sent him a username and password for a service. What service could this be? Provide your answer in this format: flag{name of service}

results.name: Remove the Hacker
Firewall 4
results.description: Years ago, we use to visit websites that had no security implementations or whatsoever. Now, everything is different, with all the security measures in place, we would want our website to be secure in design. What default port would you use to run our https website? Provide your answer in this format: flag{your answer}

results.name: Firewall 5
results.description: Our Windows client is connected to the intranet up and running; however, the system administrator forgot to configure the firewall to let certain traffic go through so he can check the connectivity of the Window client machine. What is this protocol that the system administrator has to allow traffic in? Provide your answer in this format: flag{your answer}

results.name: Historical Event
results.description: When was this tweeted: "**just setting up my twttr**"? Provide your answer in this format: flag{mmddyyyy}

results.name: Networking 1
results.description: When you first build the network, you have to test the connectivity. Let's say there is a newly added machine on our intranet, it's IP address is 10.10.0.105. What Linux command would you use to ping this machine with four packages/messages? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Linux Basics 9
results.description: In Linux, this command will show the current running processes and list the resources each process use. The command is? Provide your answer in this format: flag{command to run}

results.name: Vulnerability Test 1
results.description: Below is a psudo code for testing the XSS vulnerability on a webpage. The function name that is missing is? `` Provide your answer in this format: flag{function}

results.name: Vulnerability Test 2
results.description: The following psudo code represents another test, please submit the missing part as the flag. `http://localhost:8000/login.php?username=admin&password=' missing_part 1=1` Provide your answer in this format: flag{your answer}

results.name: Vulnerability Test 3
results.description:
This is a very famous local DoS test, check the code below and figure out what the missing part is, submit it as the flag. `:(){ mising_part & };:` *Please do not run the command.*
Provide the answer in this format: flag{missing part}

results.name: Vulnerability Test 4
results.description: When you run the following command, how many ports does it scan? `nmap 192.168.0.10` Provide your answer in this format: flag{number of ports}

results.name: Networking 2
results.description:
<script>setTimeout(function(){var flaginput=document.getElementById('challenge-input');flaginput.value='flag{}';flaginput.focus();flaginput.setSelectionRange(5,5);},1000);</script>

Our employee has been complaining the speed of the Intranet, currently we have fiber connections between servers and switches. The NIC on employees' workstation is capable of transfer as fast as 10Gb/s. However, the technician found that the cable is not fast enough.

In order to fully utilize the 10Gb/s 500MHz speed, what cable category (CAT) should be used?  

Provide your answer in this format: flag{cable type}

results.name: Vulnerability Test 5
results.description: In [this page](/vulntest), you will see part of an attack, read through the information and answer what type of attack was performed? Provide your answe in this format: flag{name of attack}

Introduction
results.description: A question will be shown here. Please enter the following flag to continue: flag{lets go}

results.name: System Development Life Cycle
results.description: What is the first step in system development lifecycle? 1. Systems Design 2. Systems Analysis & Requirements 3. Integration & Testing 4. Planning 5. Implementation 6. Development Please provide your answer in the format: flag{answer}

results.description: Scan the code for a message, and determine who the original author is. Provide your answer in the following format: code{FIRSTLAST}

results.description: Please design any input that satisfies the following regular expression (regex), use [regexr.com](https://regexr.com/652ll) for assistance: > flag\{[0-9]{2} +0x[0-9A-F]{4} +0b[01]{8}\} Enter the flag in the following format: flag{message}

results.description: Please design any input that satisfies the following regular expression (regex), use [regexr.com](https://regexr.com/652lo) for assistance: > flag{@[^0-9]{4}(6|7|8){4}(2|3|4){4}(x|y){4}@} Enter the flag in the following format: flag{message}

results.description:
Please enter the first name and last name of **each team member**.

Delimit each full name with a comma.

results.name: Preliminary Information 2
results.description: What is your birth month?

results.name: Coordination using Zoom Chat
results.description:
Some questions will require talking to other participants in this CTF game, to do this, `please use the individual chat function/direct messaging feature in Zoom`.
<hr>

Ensure that the chat is private by seeing `(Direct Message)` above the message:
<center>
	
![](/files/ac3b509b339d8d3f0e547a0336c02007/ZoomDirectMessage.png)
</center>
<hr>

Please say hello to another participant other than yourself by using the individual one-on-one chat function on Zoom.

Who did you talk to? Enter their nickname/name.

results.name: Birthday Month 1
results.description: Who has a birthday in September?

results.name: Birthday Month 2
results.description: Who has a birthday in November?
